Overview.Summary: The 2021 Cypriot legislative election took place on May 28, 2021 (10). The election resulted in the ruling Conservative party maintaining control in Devon (1) and the Liberal Democrats winning in Hull (7). The Scottish Liberal Democrats have launched their manifesto for the election (3). The election also sparked discussions about the new election law in Georgia (4). The election in Albania resulted in a victory for Prime Minister Edi Rama (6). In Assam, the counting of votes is still underway (9). The future of democracy and security was a major aspect of these elections (8).

Timeline.Text: The 2021 Cypriot legislative election takes place, with a strong focus on democratic rallies.
The Scottish Liberal Democrats launch their 2021 election manifesto, which includes promises related to democratic rallies.
The Conservatives maintain control in Devon, with the Greens gaining a second seat.
The Hull City Council elections take place, with a focus on democratic rallies.

Overview.Summary: The 2021 Cypriot legislative election (9) took place on May 30 and resulted in the election of Annita Demetriou as the first woman Speaker of the House of Representatives (5). The election was overshadowed by simmering public anger over the "golden passports" corruption scandal (9). The new Ambassador of Cyprus to Kyrgyzstan, Andreas Zenonos, presented his Credentials on Thursday, 24 June (1). Rival Greek Cypriot and Turkish Cypriot leaders also met in Geneva to explore elusive "common ground" (3). Additionally, the Syrian presidential election opened for expatriates in Cyprus (4). In Turkey, President Recep Tayyip Erdogan faced setbacks in his Islamic ambitions in Turkish Cyprus (8).
